criteria: Calculation and Interpretation of Relative Frequencies
descriptions: No attempt to construct a two-way frequency table or the table is completely incorrect and irrelevant to the data.
Constructs a two-way frequency table with significant errors in organization and calculation of frequencies.
Constructs a two-way frequency table with some errors in organization or calculation of frequencies.
Constructs a two-way frequency table that is mostly accurate, with only minor errors.
Constructs an accurate and well-organized two-way frequency table.
Constructs an exceptionally clear, accurate, and well-organized two-way frequency table.
No attempt to calculate relative frequencies or the calculations are completely incorrect.
Calculates relative frequencies with significant errors or demonstrates no understanding of their meaning.
Calculates relative frequencies with some errors or demonstrates a limited understanding of their meaning.
Calculates relative frequencies accurately but provides a superficial or incomplete interpretation.
Accurately calculates and interprets joint, marginal, and conditional relative frequencies in the context of the data.
Provides a thorough, nuanced, and insightful interpretation of joint, marginal, and conditional relative frequencies, demonstrating a deep understanding of their implications.
No attempt to identify associations or trends in the data.
Attempts to identify associations or trends but draws incorrect or unsupported conclusions.
Identifies some associations or trends but with limited justification or explanation.
Recognizes possible associations and trends in the data with reasonable justification.
Clearly and accurately identifies associations and trends in the data, providing strong justification based on the relative frequencies.
Provides a sophisticated analysis of associations and trends in the data, including consideration of potential confounding variables and alternative explanations.
